name: Vanilla JS
more: My very FIRST time building something using pure Javascript. The interface may be aesthethically simple, but the logic behind it (as a beginner) feels like a HUGE accomplishment. It's a multiple choice coding quiz that keeps track of user score time and correct answers.

more.name: Mobile-First Responsive Design with 2 API calls
more.more: This was a TEAM project with four contributors for learning purposes. My primary role was to style a responsive page using bootstrap, a CSS framework. It works as a single-page application with auto-scroll and parallex effect.

more.name: Vanilla JS with API calls
more.more: Second build with Vanilla Javascript. I used Day.js as a third party API to build a scheduling interface. Past, present, future times are color coded. The time slots can save text to localStorage. This allows the rendering of all saved content upon page refresh.

more.name: jQuery with (Server-Side) API calls
more.more: I used a Weather API with jQuery to retrieve external JSON data. Thus, typing in a city and clicking on the search button will display weather information for that city. A 'clickable' search history will also appear on the page.
